thread.title: Batman And Swamp Thing Team Up In New Justice League Action Clip
thread.title_full: Batman And Swamp Thing Team Up In New Justice League Action Clip

author: Matthew Mueller
title: Batman And Swamp Thing Team Up In New Justice League Action Clip
text:
Batman And Swamp Thing Team Up In New Justice League Action Clip Matthew Mueller Start Photo Gallery Back to Article Image of 
When the undead start roaming the streets, the Justice League calls in the magical reinforcements. Luckily for Batman, Zatanna and John Constantine happened to be available. 
Well, available might not be the most applicable term. as the two seem to have their hands full with Brother Night. Still, who says they can't fight ghouls and give Batman a 101 in magical artifacts at the same time? 
Unfortunately, those three won't be enough to stop the coming Zombie army, which is now under the leadership of Solomon Grundy. The good news is that the team is going to get a helping hand from fan favorite Swamp Thing. 
You can view the full clip above, and the official description for the episode can be found below. 
When Grundy escapes his Louisiana prison, intent on using a magical crystal to raise an army of the dead from their graves, only Batman and Swamp Thing (voiced by Mark Hamill) stand in the way of his growing zombie army. 
The episode is written by Paul Dini, and airs Saturday, February 4, 7:30 am on Cartoon Network. You can find several images from the upcoming episode in the gallery. 
Batman, Superman and Wonder Woman lead the DC Comics Super Heroes against their most infamous foes in adventures packed with relentless thrills, fun and action. No need to wait for the good stuff to start, each eleven-minute episode jumps in with lightning-paced action and heroics. Whether defending the Earth, facing invaders from space, or battling the bizarre forces of magic, the always-rotating team of Justice League heroes, are up to any challenge. 
The voice-cast features Kevin Conroy as Batman, Mark Hamill as the Joker, James Woods as Lex Luthor, Diedrich Bader as Booster Gold, Sean Astin as Shazam, Rachel Kimsey as Wonder Woman, Jason J. Lewis as Superman, Chris Diamantopoulos as Green Arrow, and Josh Keaton as Green Lantern. 
Sam Register (Teen Titans Go!) will serve as executive producer with Butch Lukic (Justice League, Batman Beyond), Alan Burnett (Batman: The Animated Series) and Jim Krieg (Green Lantern: The Animated Series) serving as producers.
